p: Epidemics of infectious diseases are currently listed among the potential catastrophes that can set the world back in the next decades [ 1]. Overwhelming research efforts have been developed to predict the danger of the epidemics but their crisis nature often left scientists no better option than learning from the past [ 1, 2]. Confronting outbreaks of emerging infections, however, requires a swift response and thus the ability to evaluate quickly and early possible outcomes [ 1]. As such, computer simulations of epidemic models undoubtedly hold the potential as the first-aid toolbox for decision making amid the crisis [ 1, 3, 4].
